content.title: AICTE - Grant For Augmenting Infrastructure In North Eastern Region
content.beneficiary: Government/ Government-aided technical/ engineering colleges/University Departments including Polytechnic Institutes
content.details: The scheme provides financial assistance to institutions located in the North East Region for solving water problems, providing alternative power support, and high-speed internet connectivity. It aims to enhance the functional efficiency of technical institutes by addressing deficiencies in these areas.
benefits: Funding for solving water problems up to ₹ 15,00,000
Funding for power/solar energy projects up to ₹ 20,00,000
Funding for internet connection projects up to ₹ 5,00,000
Advance of 80% of the sanctioned grant as the first installment
Reimbursement on successful completion of the project
eligibility: Institutions must be in existence for the last five years
Government/ Government-aided technical/ engineering colleges/University Departments including Polytechnic Institutes of North East
content.application_process: Download and fill out the application form, verify signatures, attach essential documents, and send via registered post to the Advisor, Institutional Development Cell, AICTE.
documents_required: Abstract of the estimates of the project
PWD/CPWD rate certificate of the project
Conformity with the norms as suggested by the AICTE
Certificate from the Principal/Competent Authority regarding additional expenditure

faqs.question: Why Are Water Harvesting Projects Supported Under The Scheme?
faqs.answer: Water harvesting projects are supported to ensure a secured water supply during the dry season.

faqs.question: Who Is The Implementing Agency For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Scheme is being implemented through the Indian Institute of Technology– Guwahati.

faqs.question: What Is The Objective Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: To enhance the functional efficiency of technical institutes by addressing deficiencies in water, electricity, and internet connectivity.

faqs.question: Why Is Setting Up An Initial Internet Connection Considered Under The Scheme?
faqs.answer: To mitigate the problem of inadequate internet connectivity in the North Eastern Region.

faqs.question: What Is The Limit Of Funding For The 'Solving Water Problems' Project?
faqs.answer: Limit of Funding: ₹ 15,00,000 for a duration of 2 years.

faqs.question: What Is The Limit Of Funding For The 'Power/ Solar Energy Project' Project?
faqs.answer: Limit of Funding: ₹ 20,00,000 for a duration of 6 months.

faqs.question: What Is The Limit Of Funding For The 'Internet Connection Project' Project?
faqs.answer: Limit of Funding: ₹ 5,00,000 for a duration of 6 months.

faqs.question: How Will The Disbursement Of The Funds Be Done?
faqs.answer: The first installment is an advance of 80% of the sanctioned grant, and the second installment is reimbursement upon successful project completion.

faqs.question: What If The Institute Fails To Initiate The Project Within Six Months?
faqs.answer: The institute must refund the complete grant with accrued interest to AICTE with justification.

faqs.question: Who Should Audit The Utilization Certificate And Statement Of Accounts?
faqs.answer: They must be audited by the Finance Officer/Account Officer.

faqs.question: What Documents Are To Be Submitted For The Procurement Of Solar Power Energy Equipment/Generator/Internet Connection?
faqs.answer: Documentary proof of cost and a certificate from the Principal/Competent Authority regarding additional expenditure.
